name: oblige
content:
oblige verb
(FORCE)
Add to word list

[ T + obj + to infinitive ] (US or UK formal also obligate) to force someone to do something, or to make it necessary for someone to do something: The law obliges companies to pay decent wages to their employees. The law does not obligate sellers to accept the highest offer.

oblige verb
(HELP)
C1 [ I or T ] to please or help someone, especially by doing something they have asked you to do: We only went to the party to oblige some old friends who asked us to be there. We needed a guide and he was only too happy to oblige.

Sellers are not legally obliged to accept the highest offer. Companies are obliged by law to carry out regular safety checks. a law/treaty/agreement obliges sth The law obliges full disclosure of political contributions.
